message.content:
cs.NE, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.SY

The paper proposes a method for overcoming catastrophic forgetting in neural networks, which is a problem in the field of neural networks and machine learning. The method is based on the cholinergic neuromodulatory system in the brain, which is related to neuroscience and biology. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). The paper also involves learning synaptic importances in an online and seamless manner, which is related to reinforcement learning and optimization, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) another likely sub-category. The paper uses Hebbian learning and backpropagation algorithm, which are common techniques in artificial intelligence, making cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) another likely sub-category. The paper also tests the proposed method on image classification tasks, which is related to computer vision, making cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) another likely sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes a biologically inspired method, which is related to systems and control, making cs.SY (Systems and Control) another likely sub-category.
